weather_report:
Subiaco wakes to a clean, unblemished sky; the light has that gentle snap of clarity that makes colors honest and edges sharp. The sun is already confident and will stay that way, with the day brightening steadily and the air feeling open and uncomplicated. With so little cloud to soften it, expect the UV to build as the morning stretches on; even without heat, the rays will be punchy around the middle of the day, so a touch of sunscreen and a brimmed hat are wise companions.

It looks like a pleasantly straightforward day: sunny, dry, and good for moving at an easy pace. Dress in light layers you can peel back, breathable fabrics, sunglasses tucked in your pocket, and comfortable shoes for wandering. Take your coffee at a sidewalk table, then meander through the local shops or slip by the library to return a book. A late-morning stroll through a leafy street will be lovely; by early afternoon, find a patch of shade, tend a few errands, or water the balcony herbs and let the quiet brightness do its work.
